name: Delay (Stereo)
description: This algorithm is a simple stereo in/stereo out delay effect. The delay time can be set manually, via a clock pulse, or via MIDI clock. It can also be modulated via its 'V/oct input', which halves the delay time for every 1V rise in CV (conversely, doubles it for every 1V fall in CV). The 'Fractional' parameter allows for delay times that are not integer multiples of the sample rate, slightly increasing CPU load but improving sound quality when modulated, such as for chorus or flange effects. Turning fractional off results in a clean digital delay with no coloration in repeats.

specifications.name: Max_delay_time
specifications.description: The maximum delay time supported is 1-30 seconds.

parameters.name: Fractional
parameters.description: Enables fractional delay times, which slightly increases CPU load but improves sound quality when modulated.

parameters.name: Block_DC
parameters.description: Enables a DC blocker at the delay input. Recommended for audio use; disable when processing CVs.

parameters.name: Clock_input
parameters.description: The input bus to use for the clock, if the source is 'Clock_input'.

parameters.name: MIDI_divisor
parameters.description: The MIDI divisor, if the clock source is 'MIDI_clock'.

parameters.name: MIDI_numerator
parameters.description: The MIDI numerator, if the clock source is 'MIDI_clock'.

input_ports.name: Clock_input_port
input_ports.description: The clock input port, if the source is 'Clock_input'.

input_ports.name: V_oct_input_port
input_ports.description: The input bus to use for 1V/octave modulation of the delay time.
